Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType>
class stDFMemLeafNode< ObjectType >

This class template implements a memory shell for a stDFLeafNode instance. It implements a memory optimized leaf node wich simulates the physical occupation of the original node.

Since all objects are stored using their implementation (not the serialized form), this class is very useful to optimize heavy object manipulations such as SlimDown and MinMax algorithms.

By the other side, this class will unserialize all objects of the node without exceptions. Due to that, the use of this class is not recommended for procedures with low rate of object unserializations/serializations. Another disadvantage of this class is the potential high memory usage.

Author:
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)
See also:
stDFLeafNode

Member Function Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
bool stDFMemLeafNode< ObjectType >::Add (  ObjectType *  obj,
stDistance  distance
) 
 

Adds an object to this node.

All entries are sorted in crescent order of distance to allow complex object manipulation such as SlimDown.

Parameters:
obj An object to be insert.
distance A correspondent distance of the new entry.
Returns:
True for success or false otherwise.

True for success or false otherwise.

template<class ObjectType>
stDFLeafNode* stDFMemLeafNode< ObjectType >::ReleaseNode (   ) 
 

Release the resources of this class template and construct a new DFLeafNode that has all entries in this instance.

Note:
The resulting node will have all objects sorted according to their distance from the representative object (in ascendent order).
Returns:
A new instance of stDFLeafNode.
